snippet.title: Pilot lands jet hit by giant hailstones
snippet.content:
A UKRAINIAN pilot has been labelled a hero after landing a jet "blind" when giant hailstones smashed the windscreen and destroyed the nose cone. Pilot Alexander Akopov, who works for Turkish company Atlasglobal, made the heroic emergency landing of the damaged passenger jet at Istanbul's Ataturk airport after a freak thunderstorm struck. Pilot makes emergency landing 'blind'
A Youtube video posted by Ватные Хроники captured the moment the plane landed, with one man on the film heard saying in the background: "He won't do it, he won't do it." The post said there were 121 passengers and six crew members on board but "thanks to the skill of our pilot, no one was hurt". Others on Facebook described the hail as being the size of "chicken eggs". Oleg Lungal wrote the "Ukrainian crew and two Turkish flight attendants showed courage in the process of this incident". He said when the plane landed everyone applauded and other pilots came on board to shake his hand.
